intro: Calystegia pubescens f. major, commonly known as the hairy bindweed, is a variant of the species Calystegia pubescens. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Convolvulaceae, characterized by its trailing or climbing habit. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a pubescent (hairy) surface, and its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
